=== Roadmap ===

* Upgrade our main server (hosted by Canonical) to xenial
** this requires some coordination as we need to upgrade our forum to a major version and rewrite the theme, 
* Finish our new website that has been a work in progress for a few years already
* 2018-2019 meetings (<nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-it/events/history/|here are some of the past IRL events]]</nowiki>)
* Draft a new rulebook for the renewal of the council, to better reflect the changes that happened to the community in the last decade
* Evaluate and possibly host an Ubucon in the next years

=== Organization ===
The working teams are those groups that maintain certain services for the community. Current activities include: website, forum, mailing list, irc, wiki, translations, social media, sysadmins and more.

All groups have a dedicated mailing list (the Siena LUG provides us with a small server with a mailman instance that handles the <nowiki>[[http://liste.ubuntu-it.org]]</nowiki> domain to provide local mailing lists), and/or an email address (an alias) to be contacted.
We don't have a team that administer/moderate all our mailing lists (other than overall administration of mailman), the administration/moderation is left to the members of that particular group based on their needs.

==== The Working Teams ====

The active groups, counting as of 2016-08-26 '''80 people''' in total, are:

* Web - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoWeb]]</nowiki>
** 3 members, in charge of <nowiki>[[https://www.ubuntu-it.org]]</nowiki>
* Forum - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoForum]]</nowiki>
** 10 members, in charge of <nowiki>[[https://forum.ubuntu-it.org]]</nowiki> with about 175,000 users
* Documentation - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoDocumentazione]]</nowiki>
** 15 stable members, in charge of <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org]]</nowiki>
* Translation - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoTraduzione]]</nowiki>
** 4 members, in charge of launchpad translations
* FCM Magazine - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/Fcm]]</nowiki>
** 3 members, in charge of the <nowiki>[[https://www.fullcirclemagazine.org/|Full Circle Magazine]]</nowiki> translation.
* Development - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoSviluppo]]</nowiki>
** 6 approved members, mentoring packaging and application development
* Marketing - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoPromozione]]</nowiki>
** 18 stable members, producing a weekly newsletter, moderating social networks resources and other <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoPromozione/Progetti#Progetti|projects]]</nowiki>
* IRC - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoIrc]]</nowiki>
** 15 members, operators in the various #ubuntu-it-* channels used by us
* Sysadmins - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu-it.org/GruppoSistemisti]]</nowiki>
** 5 members, managing the two underlying servers that have been donated to us

The Italian LoCo Council is responsible for the creation of the dedicated mailing lists.
